title: Talking About Plans and Predictions
description: Practice discussing your future plans and making predictions.

sentences.text: I'm going to start a new course next month.
sentences.translation: 다음 달에 새로운 강좌를 시작할 거예요.
sentences.tips: 'going to'는 미리 정한 계획을 표현해요. 'start'를 강조하세요.

sentences.text: I think technology will change our lives dramatically.
sentences.translation: 기술이 우리 삶을 극적으로 바꿀 것 같아요.

sentences.text: We're meeting the client at two o'clock tomorrow.
sentences.tips: 현재 진행형으로 정해진 약속을 표현해요. 시간을 명확히 하세요.

sentences.text: I'll probably take a vacation in August.
The meeting has been postponed until next week.
What are you planning to do after graduation?
sentences.tips: 'planning to'를 자연스럽게 연결하고, 의문문 억양으로 끝내세요.

sentences.text: I expect the project will be completed by Friday.
There's a possibility that prices will increase next year.
sentences.tips: 'There's a possibility that'은 가능성을 표현하는 공손한 표현이에요.

sentences.text: I definitely won't be able to attend the conference.
By this time next year, I'll have finished my degree.
sentences.tips: 'By this time next year'로 시작해서 미래 완료 시제를 연습하세요.

sentences.text: I'm hoping to visit Japan sometime next spring.
sentences.translation: 내년 봄 언젠가 일본을 방문하고 싶어요.
sentences.tips: 'I'm hoping to'는 희망하는 계획을 공손하게 표현해요.

sentences.text: We need to confirm the reservation in advance.

lines.text: Hi David! Do you have any plans for the weekend?
Yes, I'm going to visit my parents on Saturday. What about you?
I'm meeting some friends for brunch on Sunday. We're trying a new restaurant downtown.
That sounds nice! I think I'll probably stay home on Sunday and relax.
Good idea. Oh, by the way, the team meeting has been moved to Monday at 10.
Thanks for letting me know. I'll update my calendar.
Are you going to prepare anything for the presentation?
Yes, I'm going to work on the slides this weekend. I expect to finish by Sunday night.
Great. I'm sure the presentation will go well.
I hope so! See you on Monday then.

items: Did you pronounce 'going to' naturally (often sounds like 'gonna' in spoken English)?
Did you use correct stress on key words like 'definitely', 'probably'?
Did you use appropriate intonation for questions about plans?
Did you speak at a natural pace?
Did you speak smoothly without unnecessary pauses?
Did you use time expressions naturally?
Did you complete all sentences confidently?
Did you practice the dialogue with natural flow?
Did you use 'will' correctly for predictions?
Did you use 'going to' correctly for plans?
Did you use Present Continuous for arrangements?
Did you choose the right future form for each situation?
Could a listener understand your plans clearly?
Did you express certainty and uncertainty appropriately?
Did you sound natural when discussing the future?
Did you use appropriate vocabulary for plans and predictions?
